page.title: 01The Cheshunt Area
page.content: Cheshunt can be divided into two contrasting areas; the urban sprawl of the town itself and the rural area centred on Goffs Oak. Open farmland is being replaced by new housing developments such as the Rosedale Estate, originally built by the GLC to provide homes for families from Hackney and Islington. This contrasts with attractive, detached properties around Goffs Oak. Transport facilities to London are excellent although many people work locally. A new swimming pool, sports hall and shopping centre have recently been built. Everyone knows of the new Tescos and Spurs football ground but signs of Cheshunt's historical past are still evident in St. Mary's Church,Cedar Park and a few old houses.
